radiographic_examinations.findings: Several nodular densities suggestive of arteriovenous malformations.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Air-Contrast Upper Gastrointestinal Series with Small-Bowel Follow-Through
radiographic_examinations.findings: Marked thickening of the gastric folds with multiple filling defects in the antrum, and irregularity in the duodenal bulb that might represent additional polyps.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Angiographic Study of the External Carotid Arteries
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple telangiectatic lesions involving all portions of the nasal mucosa, hard and soft palates, portions of the gingivae, and the tongue.
Abnormal vascular channels in the liver consistent with vascular malformations.
Lobulated mass in the posterior left lower lung with two vessels feeding it, features consistent with an arteriovenous malformation; multiple tortuous vascular channels in the liver.
Multiple bilateral pulmonary arteriovenous malformations, 2 to 4 cm in diameter.
Innumerable arteriovenous malformations in the liver.
Porencephaly affecting most of the right temporal and occipital lobes; no evidence of a vascular malformation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeated scanning three months before admission showed no change from earlier examinations.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Successful embolization of the largest arteriovenous malformations.
Multiple duodenal polyps with dysplasia and intramucosal carcinoma, but no invasive carcinoma.
